abstract.p: Lawrence Clark letter on Joseph Sanacore's April 30 essay holds eduation may be most essential factor in making significant difference in lives of homeless children (S)

block.p: I read with much interest Joseph Sanacore's opinion essay about homeless students [''Homeless Does Not Mean Helpless,'' April 30]. Education is probably the most essential factor that will make a significant difference in the lives of homeless students, not only because it promotes better problem-solving skills but also because it supports a sense of hope for a successful future. Both perspectives are extremely important for helping the next generation of homeless children step beyond their current status.
